popt4jlib

Interface VecFunctionIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    F2, FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad, FastFFNN4TrainBGrad, FFNN4TrainBGrad, GradApproximator, GradApproximatorMT, GriewangkFunctionGrad, LinearOpFunction, MichalewiczFunctionGrad, Norm2FunctionGrad, RastriginFunctionGrad, RosenbrockFunctionGrad, TridFunctionGrad

    public interface VecFunctionIntf
extends java.io.Serializable
    definition of a vector function mapping vectors in R^n to vectors in R^m. Extends the java.io.Serializable interface so that implementing objects can be transported across JVMs in distributed computation.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VectorIntf eval(VectorIntf arg, java.util.HashMap params)
      the single method a VecFunctionIntf object must implement.
      double evalCoord(VectorIntf arg, java.util.HashMap params, int coord)
      evaluate only one coordinate (component) of the vector function.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        VectorIntf eval(VectorIntf arg,
                java.util.HashMap params)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        the single method a VecFunctionIntf object must implement.
        Parameters:
        arg - VectorIntf
        params - HashMap
        Returns:
        VectorIntf
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arg is null or not in the domain of the function.

      • evalCoord

        double evalCoord(VectorIntf arg,
                 java.util.HashMap params,
                 int coord)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        evaluate only one coordinate (component) of the vector function.
        Parameters:
        arg - VectorIntf
        params - HashMap
        coord - int must be in the range {0,1...getNumCoords()-1}
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arg is null or not in the domain of the function, or if the coord is not in the range of the dimensions of the function.
